text: I believe she's PM for **up to** 14 days. If it becomes clear during the 14 days that an alternative candidate could command a majority, she'd be expected to resign forthwith so HM could invite the alternative PM to form a govt & win a vote of confidence within the 14 day window.

text:
If you can't bring the same vote twice in the same session, one solution is to alter the nature of the vote. The other is to change the Parliamentary session. 

Some people might want to go and have a look at the Parliamentary Session of Sept 1948. All 10 days of it...
author: anthonyjwells

text: John Curtice has written a lot about this. Polls that use a nice sounding euphemism rather that actually saying "referendum" show more support, polls that do not specify the options in the referendum show more support.
author: anthonyjwells

text: Surely the important question is whether one should start by watching Meaningful Vote the Phantom Menace, or watch Meaningful Vote a  New Hope first?
author: anthonyjwells

text: I don't either, but would have imagined so - the new editor was very forthright in saying its previous tone was downright offensive & Islamophobic.
author: anthonyjwells

text: Depends if it becomes a big thing. Most political events have no real impact because the people who are most likely to switch aren't paying enough attention to notice. Biggest impact would be if he joined TIG, as it would give them some more momentum and put them back in the news
author: anthonyjwells

text: That's probably something to do with different approaches to weighting (YG weights by social grade & political interest, Survation weights by income). Could even be things as subtle as the interlocking between weighting targets, or when weighting info is collected.
author: anthonyjwells

text: There is no easy obvious explanation (there rarely is) - there are no large differences in things like turnout or don't knows, implying it is a difference in the samples. it seems to be that Survation's 2017 Labour voters are more likely to be sticking with Labour than YG's
author: anthonyjwells
